STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.ALLERGIES.DESC: This Duplicant will sneeze uncontrollably when exposed to the pollen present in <link="POLLENGERMS">Floral Scent</link>
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.ALLERGIES.NAME: Allergies
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.ANEMIC.DESC: This Duplicant has trouble keeping up with the others
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.ANEMIC.NAME: Anemic
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.ANXIOUS.DESC: This Duplicant collapses when put under too much pressure
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.ANXIOUS.NAME: Anxious
This Duplicant was never taught the phrase "take only pictures, leave only footprints"
This Duplicant hands out balloons when they are <style="KKeyword">Overjoyed</style>
This Duplicant has good bedside manner and a healing touch
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.BINGEEATER.DES: This Duplicant will dangerously overeat when <style="KKeyword">Stressed</style>
This Duplicant might actually be several black holes in a trench coat
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.CANTBUILD.DESC: This Duplicant is incapable of building even the most basic of structures
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.CANTBUILD.NAME: Unconstructive
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.CANTCOOK.DESC: This Duplicant has a deep-seated distrust of the culinary arts
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.CANTCOOK.NAME: Gastrophobia
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.CANTDIG.DESC: This Duplicant's fear of holes makes it impossible for them to dig
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.CANTDIG.NAME: Trypophobia
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.CANTRESEARCH.D: This Duplicant isn't the brightest star in the solar system
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.DEEPERDIVERSLU: This Duplicant was a talented opera singer and a snorkeling instructor.
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.DIVERSLUNG.DES: This Duplicant could have been a talented opera singer in another life
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.EARLYBIRD.DESC: This Duplicant always wakes up feeling fresh and efficient!
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.EARLYBIRD.EXTE: • Morning: {0} bonus to all Attributes • Duration: 5 Schedule Blocks
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.EARLYBIRD.NAME: Early Bird
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.EARLYBIRD.SHOR: Morning: +2 bonus to all Attributes • Duration: 5 Schedule Blocks
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.FASTLEARNER.DE: This Duplicant's sharp as a tack and learns new skills with amazing speed
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.FLATULENCE.DES: Some Duplicants are just full of it
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.FOODIE.DESC: This Duplicant's refined palate demands only the most luxurious dishes the colony can offer
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.FOODIE.NAME: Gourmet
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.FUSSY.DESC: Nothing's ever quite good enough for this Duplicant
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.FUSSY.NAME: Fussy
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.GREASEMONKEY.D: This Duplicant likes to throw a wrench into the colony's plans... in a good way
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.HEMOPHOBIA.DES: This Duplicant is of delicate disposition and cannot tend to the sick
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.INTERIORDECORA: "Move it a little to the left..."
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.IRONGUT.DESC: This Duplicant can eat just about anything without getting sick
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.IRONGUT.NAME: Iron Gut
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.IRONGUT.SHORT_: Eating food contaminated with <link="FOODSICKNESS">Food Poisoning</link> Germs will not affect this Duplicant
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.IRRITABLEBOWEL: This Duplicant needs a little extra time to "do their business"
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.MOLEHANDS.DESC: They're great for tunneling, but finding good gloves is a nightmare
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.MOLEHANDS.NAME: Mole Hands
This Duplicant sucks up way more than their fair share of <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link>
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.NARCOLEPSY.DES: This Duplicant can and will fall asleep anytime, anyplace
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.NARCOLEPSY.SHO: This Duplicant's work will be periodically interrupted by naps
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.NEEDS.CLAUSTRO: This Duplicant feels suffocated in spaces fewer than four tiles high or three tiles wide
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.NEEDS.CLIMACOP: Climbing ladders more than four tiles tall makes this Duplicant's stomach do flips
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.NEEDS.FASHIONA: This Duplicant dies a bit inside when forced to wear unstylish clothing
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.NEEDS.PREFERSC: This Duplicant has some extra <style="KKeyword">Insulation</style>, so the room <style="KKeyword">Temperature</style> affects them a little less
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.NEEDS.PREFERSW: This Duplicant doesn't have much <style="KKeyword">Insulation</style>, so they are more <style="KKeyword">Temperature</style> sensitive than others
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.NEEDS.SENSITIV: This Duplicant is a sensitive sole and would rather walk on tile than raw bedrock
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.NEEDS.SOLITARY: This Duplicant prefers to sleep alone
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.NEEDS.WORKAHOL: This Duplicant gets antsy when left idle
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.NIGHTOWL.DESC: This Duplicant does their best work when they'd ought to be sleeping
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.NIGHTOWL.EXTEN: • Nighttime: {0} bonus to all Attributes • Duration: All Night
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.NIGHTOWL.NAME: Night Owl
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.NIGHTOWL.SHORT: Nighttime: +3 bonus to all Attributes • Duration: All Night
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.NOODLEARMS.DES: This Duplicant's arms have all the tensile strength of overcooked linguine
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.ROCKCRUSHER.DE: This Duplicant's got muscles on their muscles!
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.SIMPLETASTES.D: This Duplicant's dull senses could barely tell the difference between <link="SALSA">Stuffed Berry</link> and cardboard
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.SLOWLEARNER.DE: This Duplicant's a little slow on the uptake, but gosh do they try
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.SMALLBLADDER.D: This Duplicant has a tiny, pea-sized <style="KKeyword">Bladder</style>. Adorable!
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.SNORER.DESC: In space, everyone can hear you snore
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.SNORER.NAME: Loud Sleeper
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.SNORER.SHORT_D: This Duplicant's snoring will rudely awake nearby friends
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.SPARKLESTREAKE: This Duplicant leaves a trail of happy sparkles when they are <style="KKeyword">Overjoyed</style>
This Duplicant will spontaneously redecorate a room when they are <style="KKeyword">Overjoyed</style>
This Duplicant is liable to puke everywhere when <style="KKeyword">Stressed</style>
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.STRONGARM.DESC: This Duplicant has muscles on their muscles
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.STRONGARM.NAME: Buff
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.STRONGIMMUNESY: This Duplicant's immune system bounces back faster than most
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.SUNNYDISPOSITI: This Duplicant has an unwaveringly positive outlook on life
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.SUPERPRODUCTIV: This Duplicant is super productive when they are <style="KKeyword">Overjoyed</style>
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.TWINKLETOES.DE: This Duplicant is light as a feather on their feet
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.UGLYCRIER.DESC: If this Duplicant gets too <style="KKeyword">Stressed</style> it won't be pretty
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.UGLYCRIER.NAME: Ugly Crier
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.UNCULTURED.DES: This Duplicant has simply no appreciation for the arts
STRINGS.DUPLICANTS.TRAITS.WEAKIMMUNESYST: All the vitamin C in space couldn't stop this Duplicant from getting sick
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.AEROGEL.NAME: <link="AEROGEL">Aerogel</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.ALGAE.DESC:
Algae is a cluster of non-motile, single-celled lifeforms.

It can be used to produce <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link> when used in a <link="MINERALDEOXIDIZER">Oxygen Diffuser</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.ALGAE.NAME: <link="ALGAE">Algae</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.ALUMINUM.DESC:
(Al) Aluminum is a low density <link="REFINEDMETAL">Metal</link>.

It has high Thermal Conductivity and is suitable for building <link="POWER">Power</link> systems.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.ALUMINUM.NAME: <link="ALUMINUM">Aluminum</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.ALUMINUMGAS.DESC: (Al) Aluminum is a low density <link="REFINEDMETAL">Metal</link> heated into a <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gaseous</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.ALUMINUMGAS.NAME: <link="ALUMINUMGAS">Aluminum</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.ALUMINUMORE.DESC:
Aluminum ore, also known as Bauxite, is a sedimentary rock high in metal content.

It can be refined into <link="ALUMINUM">Aluminum</link>.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.ALUMINUMORE.NAME: <link="ALUMINUMORE">Aluminum Ore</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.BITUMEN.DESC: Bitumen is a sticky viscous residue left behind from <link="PETROLEUM">Petroleum</link> production.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.BITUMEN.NAME: <link="BITUMEN">Bitumen</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.BLEACHSTONE.DESC:
Bleach stone is an unstable compound that emits unbreathable <link="CHLORINEGAS">Chlorine</link>.

It is useful in <link="HYGIENE">Hygienic</link> processes.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.BLEACHSTONE.NAME: <link="BLEACHSTONE">Bleach Stone</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.BOTTLEDWATER.NAME: <link="BOTTLEDWATER">Water</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.BRICK.DESC: Brick is a hard, brittle material formed from heated Clay. It is a reliable Construction Material.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.BRICK.NAME: <link="BRICK">Brick</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.BRINE.DESC:
Brine is a natural, highly concentrated solution of <link="SALT">Salt</link> dissolved in <link="WATER">Water</link>.

It can be used in desalination processes, separating out useable salt.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.BRINE.NAME: <link="BRINE">Brine</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.BRINEICE.DESC:
Brine is a natural, highly concentrated solution of <link="SALT">Salt</link> dissolved in <link="WATER">Water</link>.

It can be used in desalination processes, separating out useable salt.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.BRINEICE.NAME: <link="BRINEICE">Brine Ice</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CARBON.DESC:
(C) Coal is a combustible fossil fuel composed of carbon.

It is useful in <link="POWER">Power</link> production.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CARBON.NAME: <link="CARBON">Coal</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CARBONDIOXIDE.DESC:
(CO<sub>2</sub>) Carbon Dioxide is an atomically heavy chemical compound in a <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gaseous</link> state.

It tends to sink below other gases.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CARBONDIOXIDE.NAME: <link="CARBONDIOXIDE">Carbon Dioxide</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CARBONFIBRE.DESC: Carbon Fiber is a <link="REFINEDMINERAL">Manufactured Material</link> with high tensile strength.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CARBONFIBRE.NAME: <link="CARBONFIBRE">Carbon Fiber</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CARBONGAS.DESC: (C) Carbon is an abundant, versatile element heated into a <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gaseous</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CARBONGAS.NAME: <link="CARBONGAS">Carbon</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CEMENT.DESC: Cement is a refined building material used for assembling advanced buildings.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CEMENT.NAME: <link="CEMENT">Cement</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CEMENTMIX.DESC: Cement Mix can be used to create <link="CEMENT">Cement</link> for advanced building assembly.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CEMENTMIX.NAME: <link="CEMENTMIX">Cement Mix</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CERAMIC.DESC: Ceramic is a hard, brittle material formed from heated Clay. It is a reliable Construction Material.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CERAMIC.NAME: <link="CERAMIC">Ceramic</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CHLORINE.DESC: (Cl) Chlorine is a natural <link="DISEASE">Germ</link>-killing element in a <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CHLORINE.NAME: <link="CHLORINE">Chlorine</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CHLORINEGAS.DESC: (Cl) Chlorine is a natural <link="DISEASE">Germ</link>-killing element in a <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gaseous</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CHLORINEGAS.NAME: <link="CHLORINEGAS">Chlorine</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CLAY.DESC: Clay is a soft, naturally occurring composite of stone and soil that hardens at high Temperatures. It is a reliable Construction Material.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CLAY.NAME: <link="CLAY">Clay</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CONTAMINATEDOXYGEN.DESC:
(O<sub>2</sub>) Polluted Oxygen is dirty, unfiltered air.

It is breathable.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CONTAMINATEDOXYGEN.NAME: <link="CONTAMINATEDOXYGEN">Polluted Oxygen</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.COPPER.DESC:
(Cu) Copper is a conductive <link="METAL">Metal</link>.

It is suitable for building <link="POWER">Power</link> systems.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.COPPER.NAME: <link="COPPER">Copper</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.COPPERGAS.DESC: (Cu) Copper is a conductive <link="METAL">Metal</link> heated into a <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gas</link>.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.COPPERGAS.NAME: <link="COPPERGAS">Copper</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CREATURE.DESC:
(DuPe) Ooze is a slurry of water, carbon, and dozens and dozens of trace elements.

Duplicants are printed from pure <link="SOLID">Ooze</link>.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CREATURE.NAME: <link="CREATURE">Genetic Ooze</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CRUDEOIL.DESC: Crude Oil is a raw potential <link="POWER">Power</link> source composed of billions of dead, primordial organisms.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CRUDEOIL.NAME: <link="CRUDEOIL">Crude Oil</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CRUSHEDICE.DESC: (H<sub>2</sub>0) A slush of crushed, semi-solid ice.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CRUSHEDICE.NAME: <link="CRUSHEDICE">Crushed Ice</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CRUSHEDROCK.DESC: Crushed Rock is <link="IGNEOUSROCK">Igneous Rock</link> crushed into a mechanical mixture.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CRUSHEDROCK.NAME: <link="CRUSHEDROCK">Crushed Rock</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CUPRITE.DESC:
(Cu<sub>2</sub>O) Copper Ore is a conductive <link="RAWMETAL">Metal</link>.

It is suitable for building <link="POWER">Power</link> systems.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.CUPRITE.NAME: <link="CUPRITE">Copper Ore</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.DIAMOND.DESC:
(C) Diamond is industrial-grade, high density carbon.

It is very difficult to excavate.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.DIAMOND.NAME: <link="DIAMOND">Diamond</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.DIRT.DESC:
Dirt is a soft, nutrient-rich substance capable of supporting life.

It is necessary in some forms of <link="FOOD">Food</link> production.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.DIRT.NAME: <link="DIRT">Dirt</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.DIRTYICE.DESC: Polluted Ice is dirty, unfiltered water frozen into a <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.DIRTYICE.NAME: <link="DIRTYICE">Polluted Ice</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.DIRTYWATER.DESC:
Polluted Water is dirty, unfiltered <link="WATER">Water</link>.

It is not fit for consumption.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.DIRTYWATER.NAME: <link="DIRTYWATER">Polluted Water</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.ELECTRUM.DESC:
Electrum is a conductive <link="RAWMETAL">Metal</link> alloy composed of gold and silver.

It is suitable for building <link="POWER">Power</link> systems.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.ELECTRUM.NAME: <link="ELECTRUM">Electrum</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.ETHANOL.DESC:
(C<sub>2</sub>H<sub>6</sub>O) Ethanol is an advanced chemical compound.

It can be used as a highly effective fuel source when burned.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.ETHANOL.NAME: <link="ETHANOL">Ethanol</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.ETHANOLGAS.DESC: (C<sub>2</sub>H<sub>6</sub>O) Ethanol is an advanced chemical compound heated into a <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gaseous</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.ETHANOLGAS.NAME: <link="ETHANOLGAS">Ethanol</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.FERTILIZER.DESC:
Fertilizer is a processed mixture of biological nutrients.

It aids in the growth of certain <link="PLANTS">Plants</link>.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.FERTILIZER.NAME: <link="FERTILIZER">Fertilizer</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.FOOLSGOLD.DESC:
(FeS<sub>2</sub>) Pyrite is a conductive <link="RAWMETAL">Metal</link>.

Also known as "Fool's Gold", is suitable for building <link="POWER">Power</link> systems.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.FOOLSGOLD.NAME: <link="FOOLSGOLD">Pyrite</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.FOSSIL.DESC: Fossil is organic matter, highly compressed and hardened into a mineral state. It is useful as a Construction Material.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.FOSSIL.NAME: <link="FOSSIL">Fossil</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.FULLERENE.DESC: (C<sub>60</sub>) Fullerene is a form of <link="CARBON">Carbon</link> consisting of spherical molecules.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.FULLERENE.NAME: <link="FULLERENE">Fullerene</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.GLASS.DESC: Glass is a brittle, transparent substance formed from <link="SAND">Sand</link> fired at high temperatures.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.GLASS.NAME: <link="GLASS">Glass</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.GOLD.DESC:
(Au) Gold is a conductive precious <link="RAWMETAL">Metal</link>.

It is suitable for building <link="POWER">Power</link> systems.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.GOLD.NAME: <link="GOLD">Gold</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.GOLDAMALGAM.DESC:
Gold Amalgam is a conductive amalgam of gold and mercury.

It is suitable for building <link="POWER">Power</link> systems.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.GOLDAMALGAM.NAME: <link="GOLDAMALGAM">Gold Amalgam</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.GOLDGAS.DESC: (Au) Gold is a conductive precious <link="RAWMETAL">Metal</link>, heated into a <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gas</link>.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.GOLDGAS.NAME: <link="GOLDGAS">Gold</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.GRANITE.DESC: Granite is a dense composite of Igneous Rock. It is useful as a Construction Material.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.GRANITE.NAME: <link="GRANITE">Granite</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.HELIUM.DESC: (He) Helium is an atomically lightweight, chemical <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gas</link>.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.HELIUM.NAME: <link="HELIUM">Helium</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.HYDROGEN.DESC: (H) Hydrogen is the universe's most common and atomically light element in a <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gaseous</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.HYDROGEN.NAME: <link="HYDROGEN">Hydrogen</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.ICE.DESC: (H<sub>2</sub>0) Ice is clean water frozen into a <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.ICE.NAME: <link="ICE">Ice</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.IGNEOUSROCK.DESC: Igneous Rock is a composite of solidified volcanic rock. It is useful as a Construction Material.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.IGNEOUSROCK.NAME: <link="IGNEOUSROCK">Igneous Rock</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.IRON.NAME: <link="IRON">Iron</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.IRONGAS.DESC: (Fe) Iron is a common industrial <link="RAWMETAL">Metal</link>, heated into a <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gas</link>.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.IRONGAS.NAME: <link="IRONGAS">Iron</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.IRONINGOT.NAME: <link="IRONINGOT">Iron</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.IRONORE.DESC:
(Fe) Iron Ore is a soft <link="RAWMETAL">Metal</link>.

It is suitable for building <link="POWER">Power</link> systems.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.IRONORE.NAME: <link="IRONORE">Iron Ore</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.ISORESIN.DESC:
Isoresin is a crystallized sap composed of long-chain polymers.

It is used in the production of rare, high grade materials.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.ISORESIN.NAME: <link="ISORESIN">Isoresin</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.KATAIRITE.DESC: (Ab) Abyssalite is a resilient, crystalline element.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.KATAIRITE.NAME: <link="KATAIRITE">Abyssalite</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.LEAD.DESC:
(Pb) Lead is a soft yet extremely dense <link="REFINEDMETAL">Refined Metal</link>.

It has a low Overheat Temperature and is suitable for building <link="POWER">Power</link> systems.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.LEAD.NAME: <link="LEAD">Lead</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.LEADGAS.DESC: (Pb) Lead is a soft yet extremely dense <link="REFINEDMETAL">Refined Metal</link> heated into a <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gaseous</link>.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.LEADGAS.NAME: <link="LEADGAS">Lead</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.LIME.DESC: (CaCO3) Lime is a mineral commonly found in Critter egg shells. It is useful as a Construction Material.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.LIME.NAME: <link="LIME">Lime</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.LIQUIDCARBONDIOXIDE.DES:
(CO<sub>2</sub>) Carbon Dioxide is an unbreathable chemical compound.

This selection is currently in a <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.LIQUIDHELIUM.DESC: (He) Helium is an atomically lightweight chemical element cooled into a <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.LIQUIDHELIUM.NAME: <link="LIQUIDHELIUM">Helium</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.LIQUIDHYDROGEN.DESC:
(H) Hydrogen is a chemical <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link>.

It freezes most substances that come into contact with it.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.LIQUIDHYDROGEN.NAME: <link="LIQUIDHYDROGEN">Hydrogen</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.LIQUIDMETHANE.DESC:
(CH<sub>4</sub>) Methane is an alkane.

This selection is in a <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.LIQUIDMETHANE.NAME: <link="LIQUIDMETHANE">Methane</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.LIQUIDOXYGEN.DESC:
(O<sub>2</sub>) Oxygen is a breathable chemical.

This selection is in a <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.LIQUIDOXYGEN.NAME: <link="LIQUIDOXYGEN">Oxygen</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.LIQUIDPHOSPHORUS.DESC:
(P) Phosphorus is a chemical element.

This selection is in a <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.LIQUIDPHOSPHORUS.NAME: <link="LIQUIDPHOSPHORUS">Phosphorus</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.LIQUIDPROPANE.DESC:
(C<sub>3</sub>H<sub>8</sub>) Propane is an alkane in a <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> state.

It is useful in <link="POWER">Power</link> production.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.LIQUIDPROPANE.NAME: <link="LIQUIDPROPANE">Propane</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.LIQUIDSULFUR.DESC:
(S) Sulfur is a common chemical element and byproduct of <link="METHANE">Natural Gas</link> production.

This selection is in a <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.LIQUIDSULFUR.NAME: <link="LIQUIDSULFUR">Liquid Sulfur</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MAFICROCK.DESC: Mafic Rock an Iron-rich variation of Igneous Rock. It is useful as a Construction Material.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MAFICROCK.NAME: <link="MAFICROCK">Mafic Rock</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MAGMA.DESC: Magma is a composite of <link="IGNEOUSROCK">Igneous Rock</link> heated into a molten, <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MAGMA.NAME: <link="MAGMA">Magma</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MATERIAL_MODIFIERS.TOOL: This material will add {0} to the finished building's Decor
Buildings constructed from this material will have these properties

<style="KKeyword">Slow Heating</style> materials require a large amount of energy to raise in <style="KKeyword">Temperature</style>, and therefore heat and cool slowly

Specific Heat Capacity: {1} DTU to raise 1g by 1K

This material disperses Heat because energy transfers quickly through materials with high Thermal Conductivity Between two objects, the rate of Heat transfer will be determined by the object with the lowest Thermal Conductivity Thermal Conductivity: {1} W per degree K difference (Oxygen: 0.024 W)

<style="KKeyword">Thermally Reactive</style> materials require little energy to raise in <style="KKeyword">Temperature</style>, and therefore heat and cool quickly

Specific Heat Capacity: {1} DTU to raise 1g by 1K

This material retains Heat because energy transfers slowly through materials with low Thermal Conductivity Between two objects, the rate of Heat transfer will be determined by the object with the lowest Thermal Conductivity Thermal Conductivity: {1} W per degree K difference (Oxygen: 0.024 W)
This material will add {0} to the finished building's Overheat Temperature
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MERCURY.NAME: <link="MERCURY">Mercury</link>

STRINGS.ELEMENTS.METHANE.NAME: <link="METHANE">Natural Gas</link>

STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MOLTENALUMINUM.NAME: <link="MOLTENALUMINUM">Molten Aluminum</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MOLTENCARBON.DESC: (C) Carbon is an abundant, versatile element heated into a <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MOLTENCARBON.NAME: <link="MOLTENCARBON">Carbon</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MOLTENCOPPER.DESC: (Cu) Copper is a conductive <link="RAWMETAL">Metal</link> heated into a <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MOLTENCOPPER.NAME: <link="MOLTENCOPPER">Copper</link>

STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MOLTENGLASS.NAME: <link="MOLTENGLASS">Molten Glass</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MOLTENGOLD.DESC: (Au) Gold is a conductive precious <link="RAWMETAL">Metal</link> heated into a <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MOLTENGOLD.NAME: <link="MOLTENGOLD">Gold</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MOLTENIRON.DESC: (Fe) Iron is a common industrial <link="RAWMETAL">Metal</link> heated into a <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MOLTENIRON.NAME: <link="MOLTENIRON">Iron</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MOLTENLEAD.DESC: (Pb) Lead is an extremely dense <link="REFINEDMETAL">Refined Metal</link> heated into a <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MOLTENLEAD.NAME: <link="MOLTENLEAD">Molten Lead</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MOLTENNIOBIUM.DESC: (Nb) Niobium is a <link="RAREMATERIALS">Rare Metal</link> heated into a <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MOLTENNIOBIUM.NAME: <link="MOLTENNIOBIUM">Niobium</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MOLTENSALT.DESC: (NaCl) Molten Salt is an edible chemical compound that has been heated into a <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MOLTENSALT.NAME: <link="MOLTENSALT">Molten Salt</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MOLTENSTEEL.DESC: Steel is a <link="RAWMETAL">Metal</link> alloy of iron and carbon, heated into a hazardous <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MOLTENSTEEL.NAME: <link="MOLTENSTEEL">Steel</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MOLTENTUNGSTEN.DESC: (W) Tungsten is a crystalline <link="RAWMETAL">Metal</link> heated into a <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MOLTENTUNGSTEN.NAME: <link="MOLTENTUNGSTEN">Tungsten</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.MOLTENTUNGSTENDISELENID: (WSe<sub>2</sub>) Tungsten Diselenide is an inorganic <link="RAWMETAL">Metal</link> compound heated into a <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.NAPHTHA.DESC: Naphtha a distilled hydrocarbon mixture produced from the burning of <link="POLYPROPYLENE">Plastic</link>.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.NAPHTHA.NAME: <link="NAPHTHA">Naphtha</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.NIOBIUM.DESC: (Nb) Niobium is a <link="RAREMATERIALS">Rare Metal</link> with many practical applications in metallurgy and superconductor <link="RESEARCH">Research</link>.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.NIOBIUM.NAME: <link="NIOBIUM">Niobium</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.NIOBIUMGAS.DESC:
(Nb) Niobium is a <link="RAREMATERIALS">Rare Metal</link>.

This selection is in a <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gaseous</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.NIOBIUMGAS.NAME: <link="NIOBIUMGAS">Niobium</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.OBSIDIAN.DESC: Obsidian is a brittle composite of volcanic <link="GLASS">Glass</link>.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.OBSIDIAN.NAME: <link="OBSIDIAN">Obsidian</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.OXYGEN.DESC:
(O<sub>2</sub>) Oxygen is an atomically lightweight and breathable <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gas</link>, necessary for sustaining life.

It tends to rise above other gases.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.OXYGEN.NAME: <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.OXYROCK.DESC:
(Ir<sub>3</sub>O<sub>2</sub>) Oxylite is a chemical compound that slowly emits breathable <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link>.

Excavating <link="OXYROCK">Oxylite</link> increases its emission rate, but depletes the ore more rapidly.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.OXYROCK.NAME: <link="OXYROCK">Oxylite</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.PETROLEUM.DESC:
Petroleum is a <link="POWER">Power</link> source refined from <link="CRUDEOIL">Crude Oil</link>.

It is also an essential ingredient in the production of <link="POLYPROPYLENE">Plastic</link>.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.PETROLEUM.NAME: <link="PETROLEUM">Petroleum</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.PHOSPHATENODULES.DESC: (PO<sup>3-</sup><sub>4</sub>) Nodules of sedimentary rock containing high concentrations of phosphate.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.PHOSPHATENODULES.NAME: <link="PHOSPHATENODULES">Phosphate Nodules</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.PHOSPHORITE.DESC: Phosphorite is a composite of sedimentary rock, saturated with phosphate.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.PHOSPHORITE.NAME: <link="PHOSPHORITE">Phosphorite</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.PHOSPHORUS.DESC: (P) Phosphorus is a chemical element in its <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.PHOSPHORUS.NAME: <link="PHOSPHORUS">Phosphorus</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.PHOSPHORUSGAS.DESC: (P) Phosphorus is a chemical element in a <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gaseous</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.PHOSPHORUSGAS.NAME: <link="PHOSPHORUSGAS">Phosphorus</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.POLYPROPYLENE.BUILD_DES: Buildings made of this material have antiseptic properties
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.POLYPROPYLENE.DESC:
(C<sub>3</sub>H<sub>6</sub>)<sub>n</sub> <link="POLYPROPYLENE">Plastic</link> is a thermoplastic polymer.

It is useful for constructing a variety of advanced buildings and equipment.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.POLYPROPYLENE.NAME: <link="POLYPROPYLENE">Plastic</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.PONDSCUM.DESC:
Pondscum is a soft, naturally occurring composite of biological nutrients.

It may be processed into <link="FERTILIZER">Fertilizer</link> and aids in the growth of certain <link="PLANTS">Plants</link>.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.PONDSCUM.NAME: <link="PONDSCUM">Pondscum</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.PROPANE.DESC:
(C<sub>3</sub>H<sub>8</sub>) Propane is a natural alkane <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gas</link>.

It is useful in <link="POWER">Power</link> production.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.PROPANE.NAME: <link="PROPANE">Propane</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.RADIUM.DESC:
(Ra) Radium is a <link="LIGHT">Light</link> emitting radioactive substance.

It is useful as a <link="POWER">Power</link> source.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.RADIUM.NAME: <link="RADIUM">Radium</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.REFINEDCARBON.DESC: (C) Refined carbon is solid element purified from raw <link="CARBON">Coal</link>.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.REFINEDCARBON.NAME: <link="REFINEDCARBON">Refined Carbon</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.REGOLITH.DESC:
Regolith is a sandy substance composed of the various particles that collect atop terrestrial objects.

It is useful as a <style="KKeyword">Filtration Medium</style>.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.REGOLITH.NAME: <link="REGOLITH">Regolith</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.ROCKGAS.DESC: Rock Gas is rock that has been superheated into a <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gaseous</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.ROCKGAS.NAME: <link="ROCKGAS">Rock Gas</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.RUST.DESC:
Rust is an iron oxide that forms from the breakdown of <link="IRON">Iron</link>.

It is useful in some <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link> production processes.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.RUST.NAME: <link="RUST">Rust</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SALT.DESC:
(NaCl) Salt, also known as sodium chloride, is an edible chemical compound.

When refined, it can be eaten with meals to increase Duplicant <link="MORALE">Morale</link>.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SALT.NAME: <link="SALT">Salt</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SALTGAS.DESC: (NaCl) Salt Gas is an edible chemical compound that has been superheated into a <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gaseous</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SALTGAS.NAME: <link="SALTGAS">Salt Gas</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SALTWATER.DESC:
Salt Water is a natural, lightly concentrated solution of <link="SALT">Salt</link> dissolved in <link="WATER">Water</link>.

It can be used in desalination processes, separating out useable salt.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SALTWATER.NAME: <link="SALTWATER">Salt Water</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SAND.DESC:
Sand is a composite of granular rock.

It is useful as a <style="KKeyword">Filtration Medium</style>.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SAND.NAME: <link="SAND">Sand</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SANDCEMENT.NAME: <link="SANDCEMENT">Sand Cement</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SANDSTONE.DESC: Sandstone is a composite of relatively soft sedimentary rock. It is useful as a Construction Material.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SANDSTONE.NAME: <link="SANDSTONE">Sandstone</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SEDIMENTARYROCK.DESC: Sedimentary Rock is a hardened composite of sediment layers. It is useful as a Construction Material.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SEDIMENTARYROCK.NAME: <link="SEDIMENTARYROCK">Sedimentary Rock</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SLABS.DESC: Slabs are a refined mineral building block used for assembling advanced buildings.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SLABS.NAME: <link="SLABS">Building Slab</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SLIMEMOLD.DESC:
Slime is a thick biomixture of algae, fungi, and mucopolysaccharides.

It can be distilled into <link="ALGAE">Algae</link> and emits <link="CONTAMINATEDOXYGEN">Polluted Oxygen</link> once dug up.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SLIMEMOLD.NAME: <link="SLIMEMOLD">Slime</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SNOW.DESC:
(H<sub>2</sub>0) Snow is a mass of loose, crystalline ice particles.

It becomes <link="WATER">Water</link> when melted.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SNOW.NAME: <link="SNOW">Snow</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDCARBONDIOXIDE.DESC: (CO<sub>2</sub>) Carbon Dioxide is an unbreathable compound in a <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDCARBONDIOXIDE.NAME: <link="SOLIDCARBONDIOXIDE">Carbon Dioxide</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDCHLORINE.DESC: (Cl) Chlorine is a natural <link="DISEASE">Germ</link>-killing element in a <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDCHLORINE.NAME: <link="SOLIDCHLORINE">Chlorine</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDCRUDEOIL.NAME: <link="SOLIDCRUDEOIL">Crude Oil</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDETHANOL.DESC:
(C<sub>2</sub>H<sub>6</sub>O) Ethanol is an advanced chemical compound.

It can be used as a highly effective fuel source when burned.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDETHANOL.NAME: <link="SOLIDETHANOL">Ethanol</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDHYDROGEN.DESC: (H) Hydrogen is the universe's most common element in a <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDHYDROGEN.NAME: <link="SOLIDHYDROGEN">Hydrogen</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDMERCURY.DESC: (Hg) Mercury is a rare <link="RAWMETAL">Metal</link> in a <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDMERCURY.NAME: <link="SOLIDMERCURY">Mercury</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDMETHANE.DESC: (CH<sub>4</sub>) Methane is an alkane in a <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDMETHANE.NAME: <link="SOLIDMETHANE">Methane</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDNAPHTHA.DESC: Naphtha is a distilled hydrocarbon mixture in a <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDNAPHTHA.NAME: <link="SOLIDNAPHTHA">Naphtha</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDOXYGEN.DESC: (O<sub>2</sub>) Oxygen is a breathable element in a <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDOXYGEN.NAME: <link="SOLIDOXYGEN">Oxygen</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDPETROLEUM.DESC:
Petroleum is a <link="POWER">Power</link> source.

This selection is in a <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDPETROLEUM.NAME: <link="SOLIDPETROLEUM">Petroleum</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDPROPANE.DESC: (C<sub>3</sub>H<sub>8</sub>) Propane is a natural gas in a <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDPROPANE.NAME: <link="SOLIDPROPANE">Propane</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDSUPERCOOLANT.DESC:
Super Coolant is an industrial grade <link="FULLERENE">Fullerene</link> coolant.

This selection is in a <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDSUPERCOOLANT.NAME: <link="SOLIDSUPERCOOLANT">Super Coolant</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDVISCOGEL.DESC:
Visco-Gel is a polymer that has high surface tension when in <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> form.

This selection is in a <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOLIDVISCOGEL.NAME: <link="SOLIDVISCOGEL">Visco-Gel</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOURGAS.DESC:
Sour Gas is a hydrocarbon <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gas</link> containing high concentrations of hydrogen sulfide.

It is a byproduct of highly heated <link="PETROLEUM">Petroleum</link>.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SOURGAS.NAME: <link="SOURGAS">Sour Gas</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.STEAM.DESC: (H<sub>2</sub>0) Steam is <link="WATER">Water</link> that has been heated into a scalding <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gas</link>.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.STEAM.NAME: <link="STEAM">Steam</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.STEEL.DESC: Steel is a <link="REFINEDMETAL">Metal Alloy</link> composed of iron and carbon.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.STEEL.NAME: <link="STEEL">Steel</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.STEELGAS.DESC: Steel is a superheated <link="RAWMETAL">Metal</link> <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gas</link> composed of iron and carbon.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.STEELGAS.NAME: <link="STEELGAS">Steel</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SULFUR.DESC: (S) Sulfur is a common chemical element and byproduct of <link="METHANE">Natural Gas</link> production.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SULFUR.NAME: <link="SULFUR">Sulfur</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SULFURGAS.DESC:
(S) Sulfur is a common chemical element and byproduct of <link="METHANE">Natural Gas</link> production.

This selection is in a <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gaseous</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SULFURGAS.NAME: <link="SULFURGAS">Sulfur</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SUPERCOOLANT.DESC: Super Coolant is an industrial grade coolant that utilizes the unusual energy states of <link="FULLERENE">Fullerene</link>.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SUPERCOOLANT.NAME: <link="SUPERCOOLANT">Super Coolant</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SUPERCOOLANTGAS.DESC:
Super Coolant is an industrial grade <link="FULLERENE">Fullerene</link> coolant.

This selection is in a <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gaseous</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SUPERCOOLANTGAS.NAME: <link="SUPERCOOLANTGAS">Super Coolant</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SUPERINSULATOR.DESC: Insulation reduces <link="HEAT">Heat Transfer</link> and is composed of recrystallized <link="KATAIRITE">Abyssalite</link>.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.SUPERINSULATOR.NAME: <link="SUPERINSULATOR">Insulation</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.TEMPCONDUCTORSOLID.DESC: Thermium is an industrial metal alloy formulated to maximize <link="HEAT">Heat Transfer</link> and thermal dispersion.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.TEMPCONDUCTORSOLID.NAME: <link="TEMPCONDUCTORSOLID">Thermium</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.TESTELEMENT.DESC:
((Fe,Mn)WO<sub>4</sub>) Wolframite is a dense Metallic element in a <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link> state.

It is a source of <link="TUNGSTEN">Tungsten</link> and is suitable for building <link="POWER">Power</link> systems.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.TESTELEMENT.NAME: <link="TESTELEMENT">Test Element</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.TOXICSAND.DESC:
Polluted Dirt is unprocessed biological waste.

It emits <link="CONTAMINATEDOXYGEN">Polluted Oxygen</link> over time.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.TOXICSAND.NAME: <link="TOXICSAND">Polluted Dirt</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.TUNGSTEN.DESC:
(W) Tungsten is an extremely tough crystalline <link="RAWMETAL">Metal</link>.

It is suitable for building <link="POWER">Power</link> systems.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.TUNGSTEN.NAME: <link="TUNGSTEN">Tungsten</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.TUNGSTENDISELENIDE.DESC:
(WSe<sub>2</sub>) Tungsten Diselenide is an inorganic <link="RAWMETAL">Metal</link> compound with a crystalline structure.

It is suitable for building <link="POWER">Power</link> systems.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.TUNGSTENDISELENIDE.NAME: <link="TUNGSTENDISELENIDE">Tungsten Diselenide</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.TUNGSTENDISELENIDEGAS.D: (WSe<sub>2</sub>) Tungsten Diselenide is a superheated <link="RAWMETAL">Metal</link> compound in a <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gaseous</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.TUNGSTENGAS.DESC:
(W) Tungsten is a superheated crystalline <link="RAWMETAL">Metal</link>.

This selection is in a <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gaseous</link> state.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.TUNGSTENGAS.NAME: <link="TUNGSTENGAS">Tungsten</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.UNOBTANIUM.DESC:
(Nt) Neutronium is a mysterious and extremely resilient Metallic element.

It cannot be excavated by any Duplicant mining tool.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.UNOBTANIUM.NAME: <link="UNOBTANIUM">Neutronium</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.VACUUM.DESC: A vacuum is a space devoid of all matter.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.VACUUM.NAME: <link="VACUUM">Vacuum</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.VISCOGEL.DESC: Visco-Gel is a <link="ELEMENTSLIQUID">Liquid</link> polymer with high surface tension, preventing typical liquid flow and allowing for unusual configurations.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.VISCOGEL.NAME: <link="VISCOGEL">Visco-Gel</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.VOID.NAME: <link="VOID">Void</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.WATER.NAME: <link="WATER">Water</link>
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.WOLFRAMITE.DESC:
((Fe,Mn)WO<sub>4</sub>) Wolframite is a dense Metallic element in a <link="ELEMENTSSOLID">Solid</link> state.

It is a source of <link="TUNGSTEN">Tungsten</link> and is suitable for building <link="POWER">Power</link> systems.
STRINGS.ELEMENTS.WOLFRAMITE.NAME: <link="WOLFRAMITE">Wolframite</link>
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.AQUA_SUIT.DESC: Because breathing underwater is better than... not.
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.AQUA_SUIT.EFFE:
Supplies Duplicants with <style="oxygen">Oxygen</style> in underwater environments.

Must be refilled with <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link> at an Atmo Suit Dock when depleted.
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.AQUA_SUIT.NAME: <link="AQUASUIT">Aqua Suit</link>
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.AQUA_SUIT.RECI: Supplies Duplicants with <style="oxygen">Oxygen</style> in underwater environments.
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.ATMO_SUIT.DESC: Ensures my Duplicants can breathe easy, anytime, anywhere.
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.ATMO_SUIT.EFFE:
Supplies Duplicants with <style="oxygen">Oxygen</style> in toxic and low breathability environments.

Must be refilled with oxygen at an Atmo Suit Dock when depleted.
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.ATMO_SUIT.NAME: <link="ATMOSUIT">Atmo Suit</link>
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.ATMO_SUIT.RECI: Supplies Duplicants with <style="oxygen">Oxygen</style> in toxic and low breathability environments.
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.COOL_VEST.EFFE: Protects the wearer from <style="heat">Heat</style> by decreasing insulation.
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.COOL_VEST.NAME: <link="COOLVEST">Cool Vest</link>
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.COOL_VEST.RECI: Protects the wearer from <style="heat">Heat</style> by decreasing insulation.
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.FUNKY_VEST.DES: This transforms my Duplicant into a walking beacon of charm and style.
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.FUNKY_VEST.EFF: Increases Decor in a small area effect around the wearer.
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.FUNKY_VEST.REC: Increases Decor in a small area effect around the wearer.
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.JET_SUIT.DESC: Allows my Duplicants to take to the skies, for a time.
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.JET_SUIT.EFFEC:
Supplies Duplicants with <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link> in toxic and low breathability environments.

Must be refilled with <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link> and <link="PETROLEUM">Petroleum</link> at a Jet Suit Dock when depleted.
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.JET_SUIT.NAME: <link="JETSUIT">Jet Suit</link>
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.JET_SUIT.RECIP:
Supplies Duplicants with <link="OXYGEN">Oxygen</link> in toxic and low breathability environments.

Allows Duplicant flight.
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.OXYGEN_TANK.EF:
Allows Duplicants to breathe in hazardous environments.

Does not work when submerged in <style="liquid">Liquid</style>.
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.OXYGEN_TANK.RE:
Allows Duplicants to breathe in hazardous environments.

Does not work when submerged in <style="liquid">Liquid</style>.
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.OXYGEN_TANK_UN:
Allows Duplicants to breathe while submerged in <style="liquid">Liquid</style>.

Does not work outside of liquid.

Allows Duplicants to breathe while submerged in <style="liquid">Liquid</style>.

Does not work outside of liquid.
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.TEMPERATURE_SU: Keeps my Duplicants cool in case things heat up.

Provides insulation in regions with extreme <style="heat">Temperatures</style>.

Must be powered at a Thermo Suit Dock when depleted.
Provides insulation in regions with extreme <style="heat">Temperatures</style>.
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.WARM_VEST.EFFE: Protects the wearer from <style="heat">Cold</style> by increasing insulation.
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.WARM_VEST.NAME: <link="WARMVEST">Warm Sweater</link>
STRINGS.EQUIPMENT.PREFABS.WARM_VEST.RECI: Protects the wearer from <style="heat">Cold</style> by increasing insulation.

STRINGS.ITEMS.CARGO_CAPSULE.DESC:
A delivery system for recently printed resources.

It will dematerialize shortly.
STRINGS.ITEMS.CARGO_CAPSULE.NAME: Care Package
STRINGS.ITEMS.FOOD.BASICFORAGEPLANT.DESC:
A seedless fruit with an upsettingly bland aftertaste.

It cannot be replanted.

Digging up Buried Objects may uncover a <link="BASICFORAGEPLANT">Muckroot</link>.

<style="KKeyword">Jerry Rig</style> machine buildings to increase their efficiency.

STRINGS.LORE.BUILDINGS.Desk.ENTRY:
TO: JSTERN@GRAVITASFACILITY.NOVA
FROM: EJONES @GRAVITASFACILITY.NOVA
SUBJECT: Preliminary Calculations

Director,

Even with dramatic optimization we can't make the sheer volume of resources required to sustain a colony seed fit for even a small interplanetary travel duration. We'll need to consider serious changes if this is going to work.

E Jones
Information and Statistics Department
The Gravitas Facility
STRINGS.LORE.BUILDINGS.GeneShuffler.ENTR:
"--fascinating that memories are not already inherent in our subjects; however, none as of yet have shown signs of recognition when introduced to familiar stimuli."

"Refer to Experiment 7D."
"Refer to Experiment 7F."

"Memories must be embedded physically within the brainmaps of our subjects. The only question remains is--"
STRINGS.LORE.BUILDINGS.GeneShuffler.HEAD: LOG FRAGMENT RECOVERED
STRINGS.LORE.BUILDINGS.PropLocker.ENTRY:
To all employees;

The facility is pleased to announced that starting this week, all Fridays will now be Casual Fridays!

Please enjoy the clinically proven destressing benefits of casual attire by wearing your favorite shirt to the lab.

NOTE: Any personnel found on facility premises without regulation fullbody protection will be put on immediate notice.

Thank-you and have fun!
-Admin
STRINGS.LORE.BUILDINGS.SET_LOCKER1.ENTRY:
FIRST LAW
Energy can neither be created or destroyed, only change forms.

SECOND LAW
Entropy in an isolated system that is not in equilibrium tends to increase over time, approaching the maximum value at equilibrium.

THIRD LAW
Entropy in a system approaches a constant minimum as temperature approaches absolute zero.

ZEROTH LAW
If two thermodynamic systems are in thermal equilibrium with a third, then they are in thermal equilibrium with each other.
STRINGS.LORE.BUILDINGS.SET_LOCKER2.ENTRY: A powerful stench emanates from this locker.
STRINGS.LORE.BUILDINGS.SET_OBJECT.ENTRY:
TO: ALL
FROM: ADMIN @GRAVITASFACILITY.NOVA
SUBJECT: IMPORTANT

REMINDER TO ALL PERSONNEL
The Gravitas Facility does not officially host a "Bring Your Child To Work Day" office event. We ask that personnel please do not bring children into top secret research departments, and especially that they do not let said children play with the high velocity particle accelerators.

We thank you for your understanding.
-The Gravitas Facility
STRINGS.LORE.BUILDINGS.VendingMachine.EN:
TO: ALL
FROM: ADMIN@GRAVITASFACILITY.NOVA
SUBJECT: Unattended Cultures

For the health and safety of your fellow Facility employees, please do not store unlabeled bacterial cultures in the cafeteria fridge.
Similarly, be advised that the cafeteria dishwasher is incapable of handling petri "dishes", despite the nomenclature.

We thank you for your consideration.
-The Gravitas Facility

STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.ALLOCATED.TOO: These resources are reserved for a planned building:
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.BASICCONTROLS: • The [WASD] keys pan my view and the [MOUSE WHEEL] zooms it in and out. • [H] returns my view to the Printing Pod. • I can speed or slow my perception of time using the top left corner buttons, or by pressing [TAB], while pressing [SPACE] will pause the flow of time entirely. • I'll keep records of everything I discover in my personal DATABASE [U] to refer back to if I forget anything important.
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.BEING_INFECTE: When Duplicants come into contact with various Germs, they'll need to expend points of Immunity to resist them and remain healthy. If repeated exposes causes their Immunity to drop to 0%, they'll be unable to resist germs and will contract the next disease they encounter. Doors with Access Permissions can be built from the BASE TAB [1] of the Build menu to block Duplicants from entering biohazardous areas while they recover their spent immunity points.
Notes on keeping Duplicants in peak health

STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.DIGGING.MESSA: Everything a colony needs to get going is found in the ground. By instructing a Duplicant to dig in an area I can mine resources to build infrastructure, find food, and clear space for the colony to grow. I can access the Dig Tool [G] which allows me to select the area I want my Duplicants to dig. Duplicants will need to gain the Superhard Digging skill to mine Abyssalite and the Superduperhard Digging skill to mine Diamond and Obsidian.

STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.DISCOVERED_SP:
Amazing!

My Duplicants have managed to breach the surface of our rocky prison.

I should be careful; the region is extremely inhospitable and I could easily lose resources to the vacuum of space.
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.DISEASE_COOKI: The Food my Duplicants cook will only ever be as clean as the ingredients used to make it. Storing food in sterile or Refrigerated environments will keep food free of Germs, while carefully placed hygiene stations like Wash Basin or Shower will prevent the cooks from infecting the food by handling it. Dangerously contaminated food can be sent to compost by clicking the Compost button on the selected item.

STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.IMMIGRANTSLEF: The care packages have been disintegrated and printable Duplicants have been Oozed
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.INCREASEDEXPE:
Duplicants require better amenities over time.
These Duplicants have increased their expectations:
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.INVALIDCONSTR: These buildings cannot be constructed in the planned areas:
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.LEVELUP.NAME: Attribute increase
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.LOCOMOTIONMES: Duplicants have limited jumping and climbing abilities. They can only climb two tiles high and cannot fit into spaces shorter than two tiles or cross gaps wider than one tile. I should keep this in mind while placing errands. To check if an errand I've placed is accessible, I can select a Duplicant and click Show Navigation to view all areas within their reach.
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.LOTS_OF_GERMS: Germs such as Food Poisoning and Slimelung can cause Disease in my Duplicants. I can use the Germ Overlay [F9] to view all germ concentrations in my colony, and even detect the sources spawning them. Building Wash Basins from the Medicine Tab [8] by colony toilets will tell my Duplicants they need to wash up.
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.MOPPINGMESSAG: Polluted Water slowly emits Polluted Oxygen which accelerates the spread of Disease. Duplicants will also be Stressed by walking through Polluted Water, so I should have my Duplicants clean up spills by clicking and dragging the Mop Tool [M]
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.MORALE.MESSAG:
Food, Rooms, Decor, and Recreation all have have an effect on Duplicant Morale. Good experiences improve their Morale and poor experiences lower it. When Morale is below their Expectations, Duplicants will become Stressed.

As Duplicants are given new Skills they gain increased Expectations, and the colony will have to be improved to keep up their Morale. An overview of Morale and Stress can be viewed on the Vitals screen.
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.MORALE.NAME: Video: Duplicant Morale
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.NEARLYDRY.TOO: These Duplicants will dry off soon:
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.NEEDENERGYSOU:
<link="POWER">Power</link> is required to operate electrical buildings
------------------
<link="MANUALGENERATOR">Manual Generators</link> and <link="WIRE">Wire</link> can be built from the <link="[3]">Power Tab</link>
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.NEEDFOOD.NAME: Colony requires a food source
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.NEEDFOOD.TOOL: The colony will exhaust their supplies without a new Food source ------------------ Microbe Mushers can be built from the Food Tab [4]
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.NEEDSLEEP.TOO: My Duplicants would appreciate a place to sleep ------------------ Cots can be built from the Furniture Tab [9]
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.NEEDTOILET.TO: My Duplicants have nowhere to relieve themselves ------------------ Outhouses can be built from the Plumbing Tab [5]
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.NEWTRAIT.NAME: {0} has developed a trait
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.NO_MEDICAL_CO: There is nowhere for sick Duplicants receive medical care ------------------ Sick Bays can be built from the Medicine Tab [8]
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.NO_OXYGEN_GEN: My colony is not producing any new Oxygen ------------------ Oxygen Diffusers can be built from the Oxygen Tab [2]
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.OUTPUTBLOCKED: Blocked <style="KKeyword">Pipes</style> have stopped these systems from functioning:
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.PLUMBING.MESS: When connecting pipes it is useful to have the Plumbing Overlay [F6] selected. Each building which requires plumbing must have their Building Intake connected to the Output Pipe from a source such as a Liquid Pump. Liquid Pumps must be submerged in water and attached to a power source to function. Buildings often output contaminated water which must flow out of the building through piping from the Output Pipe. The water can then be expelled through Liquid Vent or filtered through a Liquid Filter and reused.
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.PLUMBING.NAME: Video: Plumbing and Ventilation
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.PLUMBING.TOOL: Notes on connecting buildings with pipes
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.POWER.MESSAGE: Generators produce power and the various buildings and machines in the colony are the Consumers. Each Consumer will pull a certain wattage from the power circuit it is connected to. I can use the Power Overlay [F2] to check the status of my circuits. If the Consumers are consuming more wattage than the Generators are producing, the Batteries will drain and there will be brownouts. Additionally, if the Consumers are consuming more wattage than the Wires can handle, the Wires will overload and burn out. To correct both these situations, I will need to reorganize my Consumers onto separate circuits.
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.POWER.NAME: Video: Power Circuits
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.PRIORITIESMES: Duplicants will choose where to work based on the priority of the errands that I give them. I can open the Priorities Screen [L] to set their Duplicant Priorities, and the Priority Tool [P] to fine tune Building Priority. Many buildings will also let me change their Priority level when I select them.
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.REDALERT.NAME: Red Alert
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.REDALERT.TOOL: The colony is prioritizing work over their individual well-being
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.RESETSKILL.TO: Duplicants <style="KKeyword">Skills</style> have been reset to defaults.
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.SCHEDULEMESSA: My Duplicants will only eat, sleep, work, or bathe during the times I allot for such activities. To make the best use of their time, I can open the Schedule Tab [PERIOD KEY] to adjust the colony's schedule and plan how they should utilize their day.
Notes on scheduling my Duplicants' time
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.SKILL_POINT_E:
These Duplicants have Skill Points that can be spent on new abilities:
{0}
Duplicants can now learn new skills
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.STRESSMANAGEM:
At 100% <link="STRESS">Stress</link>, a Duplicant will have a nervous breakdown and be unable to work.

Breakdowns can manifest in different colony-threatening ways, such as the destruction of buildings or the binge eating of food.

I can select a Duplicant and mouse over <link="STRESS">Stress</link> in their STATUS TAB to view their individual <link="STRESS">Stress Factors</link>, and hopefully minimize them before they become a problem.
Notes on keeping Duplicants happy and productive
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.STRUCTURALDAM: These buildings' structural integrity has been compromised
An exosuit was dropped because there were no empty docks available
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.SUITS.MESSAGE:
<link="ATMOSUIT">Atmo Suits</link> can be equipped to protect my Duplicants from environmental hazards like extreme <link="HEAT">Heat</link>, airborne <link="DISEASE">Germs</link>, or unbreathable <link="ELEMENTSGAS">Gas</link>. In order to utilize these suits, I'll need to hook up an Atmo Suit Dock to an Atmo Suit Checkpoint, then store one of the suits inside.

Duplicants will equip a suit when they walk past the checkpoint in the chosen direction, and will unequip their suit when walking back the opposite way.
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.SUITS.NAME: Tutorial: Atmo Suits
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.TASKPRIORITIE: Duplicants always perform errands in order of highest to lowest priority. They will harvest Food before they build, for example, or always build new structures before they mine materials. I can open the Priorities Screen [L] to set which Errand Types Duplicants may or may not perform, or to specialize skilled Duplicants for particular Errand Types.
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.THERMALCOMFOR: Environments that are extremely Hot or Cold affect my Duplicants' internal body temperature and cause undue Stress. Opening the Temperature Overlay [F3] and checking the Thermal Tolerance box allows me to view all areas where my Duplicants will feel discomfort and be unable to regulate their internal body temperature.
Notes on helping Duplicants keep their cool
STRINGS.MISC.NOTIFICATIONS.TUTORIAL_OVER:
When constructing buildings, I should always take note of their <link="HEAT">Overheat Temperature</link> and plan their locations accordingly. Maintaining low ambient temperatures and good ventilation in the colony will also help keep building temperatures down.

If I allow buildings to exceed their Overheat Temperature they will begin to take damage, and if left unattended, they will break down and be unusable until repaired.
Notes on preventing building from breaking

STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.MEDICINEIV.NAME: <link="MEDICINEIV">Micro-Targeted Medicine</link>
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.PLASTICS.DESC: Stable, lightweight, durable. Plastics are useful for a wide array of applications.
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.PLASTICS.NAME: <link="PLASTICS">Plastic Manufacturing</link>
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.POWERREGULATION.D: Prevent wasted <link="POWER">Power</link> with improved electrical tools.
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.PRECISIONPLUMBING: Let Duplicants relax after a long day of subterranean digging with a shot of warm beanjuice.
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.PRESSUREMANAGEMEN: Unlock technologies to manage colony pressure and atmosphere.
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.PRETTYGOODCONDUCT: Pure-core wires that can handle more <link="POWER">Electrical</link> current without overloading.
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.RANCHING.DESC: Tame and care for wild critters.
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.RANCHING.NAME: <link="RANCHING">Ranching</link>
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.REFINEDOBJECTS.DE: Improve base infrastructure with new objects crafted from <link="REFINEDMETAL">Refined Metals</link>.
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.REFRACTIVEDECOR.D: New methods for working with extremely high quality art materials.
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.RENAISSANCEART.DE: The kind of art that culture legacies are made of.
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.RENEWABLEENERGY.D: Clean, sustainable <link="POWER">Power</link> production that produces little to no waste.
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.SANITATIONSCIENCE: Make daily ablutions less of a hassle.
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.SKYDETECTORS.DESC: Turn Duplicants' eyes to the skies and discover what undiscovered wonders await out there.
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.SKYDETECTORS.NAME: <link="SKYDETECTORS">Celestial Detection</link>
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.SMARTSTORAGE.DESC: Completely automate the storage of solid resources.
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.SMARTSTORAGE.NAME: <link="SMARTSTORAGE">Smart Storage</link>
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.SMELTING.DESC: High temperatures facilitate the production of purer, special use metal resources.
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.SMELTING.NAME: <link="SMELTING">Smelting</link>
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.SOLIDTRANSPORT.DE: Free Duplicants from the drudgery of day-to-day material deliveries with new methods of automation.
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.SUITS.DESC: Vital gear for surviving in extreme conditions and environments.
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.SUITS.NAME: <link="SUITS">Hazard Protection</link>
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.TEMPERATUREMODULA: Precise <link="HEAT">Temperature</link> altering technologies to keep my colony at the perfect Kelvin.
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.TRAVELTUBES.DESC: A wholly futuristic way to move Duplicants around the base.
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.TRAVELTUBES.NAME: <link="TRAVELTUBES">Transit Tubes</link>
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TECHS.VALVEMINIATURIZAT: Smaller, more efficient pumps for those low-throughput situations.
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TYPES.ALPHA.DESC:
<link="RESEARCH">Novice Research</link> is required to unlock basic technologies.
It can be conducted at a <link="RESEARCHCENTER">Research Station</link>.
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TYPES.ALPHA.NAME: Novice Research
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TYPES.BETA.DESC:
<link="RESEARCH">Advanced Research</link> is required to unlock improved technologies.
It can be conducted at a <link="ADVANCEDRESEARCHCENTER">Super Computer</link>.
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TYPES.BETA.NAME: Advanced Research
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TYPES.GAMMA.DESC:
<link="RESEARCH">Interstellar Research</link> is required to unlock space technologies.
It can be conducted at a <link="COSMICRESEARCHCENTER">Virtual Planetarium</link>.
STRINGS.RESEARCH.TYPES.GAMMA.NAME: Interstellar Research

STRINGS.UI.CODEX.GEYSERS.DESC:
Geysers and Fumaroles emit elements at variable intervals.They provide a sustainable, though usually low volume, source of material.

The variable factors of a geyser are:

    • Emission element 
    • Emission temperature 
    • Emission mass 
    • Cycle length 
    • Dormancy duration 
    • Disease emitted

STRINGS.UI.DEVELOPMENTBUILDS.ALPHA.LOADI:
This game is in the early stages of development which means you're likely to encounter strange, amusing, and occasionally just downright frustrating bugs.

During this time Oxygen Not Included will be receiving regular updates to fix bugs, add features, and introduce additional content, so if you encounter issues or just have suggestions to share, please let us know on our forums: <u>http://forums.kleientertainment.com</u>

A special thanks to those who joined us during our time in Alpha. We value your feedback and thank you for joining us in the development process. We couldn't do this without you.

Enjoy your time in deep space!

- Klei
Okay, thanks for the heads up!

STRINGS.UI.FRONTEND.SAVESCREEN.TITLE: SAVE SLOTS
Welcome to the Expressive Upgrade! This update introduces a new Morale system that replaces Food and Decor Expectations that were found in previous versions of the game.

The game you are trying to load was created before this system was introduced, and will need to be updated. You may either:


1) Enable the new Morale system in this save, removing Food and Decor Expectations. It's possible that when you load your save your old colony won't meet your Duplicants' new Morale needs, so they'll receive a 5 cycle Morale boost to give you time to adjust.

2) Disable Morale in this save. The new Morale mechanics will still be visible, but won't affect your Duplicants' stress. Food and Decor expectations will no longer exist in this save.

STRINGS.UI.JOBSSCREEN.TOGGLE_ADVANCED_MO: Errand Proximity Settings ------------------ Enabling Proximity settings tells my Duplicants to always choose the closest, most urgent errand to perform. When disabled, Duplicants will choose between two high priority errands based on a hidden priority hierarchy instead. Enabling Proximity helps cut down on travel time in areas with lots of high priority errands, and is useful for large colonies.

STRINGS.UI.OVERLAYS.NOISE_POLLUTION.DESC: Two Sounds of equal dB will sum for a +3 dB increase. A Sound that is 10 dB quieter will add approximately +0.5 dB to the total signal. Anything more than 10 dB quieter will be inaudible.
STRINGS.UI.OVERLAYS.NOISE_POLLUTION.NAME: ACOUSTICS OVERLAY
Cacophonous
Painful
Loud
Peaceful
Quiet
Moderate
Noisy
STRINGS.UI.OVERLAYS.NOISE_POLLUTION.TOOL:
[>{0} dB]
------------------
Cacophonous noise causes significant Stress and prevents Duplicants from sleeping or researching.

Duplicant foot traffic, generators, and powered buildings can create high noise levels.

[>{0} dB]
------------------
Painful noise levels are extremely Stressful to Duplicants and will cause them physical pain.

Duplicant foot traffic, generators, and powered buildings can create high noise levels.

Exposure to loud noises causes Duplicant Stress over time and makes it difficult to sleep or concentrate
------------------
High Duplicant traffic and powered buildings can create noisy areas

Quiet areas decrease Stress, ensure Duplicants have quality sleep, and help them to concentrate
------------------
Soundproofed rooms and areas free of buildings and critters will generally be quieter.

[>{0} dB]
------------------
Loud areas will impair Duplicants' Learning abilities and cause minor Stress.

Duplicant foot traffic, generators, and powered buildings can create high noise levels.

[{0} dB]
------------------
Peaceful areas improve Duplicants' quality of sleep and Learning ability.

Soundproofed rooms and areas free of buildings and critters will generally be quieter.

[>{0} dB]
------------------
Quiet areas are necessary for Duplicants to fall asleep.

Soundproofed rooms and areas free of buildings and critters will generally be quieter.

[>{0} dB]
------------------
Duplicants will feel unrested if forced to sleep in Moderate noise.

Soundproofed rooms and areas free of buildings and critters will generally be quieter.

[>{0} dB]
------------------
Noisy areas will wake Duplicants up during the night, but are tolerable to them during the day.

Duplicant foot traffic, generators, and powered buildings can create high noise levels.

STRINGS.UI.SCHEDULEBLOCKTYPES.EAT.DESCRI:
EAT:
During Mealtime Duplicants will head to their assigned mess halls and eat.
STRINGS.UI.SCHEDULEBLOCKTYPES.EAT.NAME: Mealtime
STRINGS.UI.SCHEDULEBLOCKTYPES.HYGIENE.DE:
HYGIENE:
During <link="HYGIENE">Hygiene</link> hours Duplicants will head to their assigned washrooms to get cleaned up.
STRINGS.UI.SCHEDULEBLOCKTYPES.RECREATION:
HAMMER TIME:
During Hammer Time, Duplicants will relieve their <link="STRESS">Stress</link> through dance. Please be aware that no matter how hard my Duplicants try, they will absolutely not be able to touch this.
STRINGS.UI.SCHEDULEBLOCKTYPES.SLEEP.DESC:
SLEEP:
When it's time to sleep, Duplicants will head to their assigned rooms and rest.
STRINGS.UI.SCHEDULEBLOCKTYPES.SLEEP.NAME: Sleep
STRINGS.UI.SCHEDULEBLOCKTYPES.WORK.DESCR:
WORK:
During Work hours Duplicants will perform any pending errands in the colony.
STRINGS.UI.SCHEDULEBLOCKTYPES.WORK.NAME: Work
STRINGS.UI.SCHEDULEGROUPS.HYGENE.DESCRIP:
During Bathtime shifts my Duplicants will take care of their hygienic needs, such as going to the bathroom, using the shower or washing their hands.

Once they're all caught up on personal hygiene, Duplicants will head back to work.
STRINGS.UI.SCHEDULEGROUPS.HYGENE.NAME: Bathtime
STRINGS.UI.SCHEDULEGROUPS.HYGENE.NOTIFIC: During <style="KKeyword">Bathtime</style> shifts my Duplicants will take care of their hygienic needs, such as going to the bathroom, using the shower or washing their hands.
STRINGS.UI.SCHEDULEGROUPS.RECREATION.DES:
During Downtime my Duplicants they may do as they please.

This may include personal matters like bathroom visits or snacking, or they may choose to engage in leisure activities like socializing with friends.

Downtime increases Duplicant Morale.
STRINGS.UI.SCHEDULEGROUPS.RECREATION.NOT: During <style="KKeyword">Downtime</style> shifts my Duplicants they may do as they please.
STRINGS.UI.SCHEDULEGROUPS.SLEEP.DESCRIPT:
My Duplicants use Bedtime shifts to rest up after a hard day's work.

Scheduling too few bedtime shifts may prevent my Duplicants from regaining enough Stamina to make it through the following day.
STRINGS.UI.SCHEDULEGROUPS.SLEEP.NAME: Bedtime
STRINGS.UI.SCHEDULEGROUPS.SLEEP.NOTIFICA: My Duplicants use <style="KKeyword">Bedtime</style> shifts to rest up after a hard day's work.
STRINGS.UI.SCHEDULEGROUPS.WORKTIME.DESCR:
During Work shifts my Duplicants must perform the errands I have placed for them throughout the colony.

It's important when scheduling to maintain a good work-life balance for my Duplicants to maintain their health and prevent Morale loss.
STRINGS.UI.SCHEDULEGROUPS.WORKTIME.NAME: Work
STRINGS.UI.SCHEDULEGROUPS.WORKTIME.NOTIF: During <style="KKeyword">Work</style> shifts my Duplicants must perform the errands I've placed for them throughout the colony.

Rockets allow you to visit nearby celestial bodies.

Each rocket must have a Command Module, an Engine, and Fuel.

You can also carry other modules that allow you to gather specific resources from the places you visit.

Remember the more weight a rocket has, the more limited it'll be on the distance it can travel. You can add more fuel to fix that, but fuel will add weight as well.

STRINGS.UI.USERMENUACTIONS.READLORE.ALRE: I already took everything of interest from this. I can check the Database to re-read what I found.
The desk is eerily empty inside.
STRINGS.UI.USERMENUACTIONS.READLORE.NAME: Inspect
STRINGS.UI.USERMENUACTIONS.READLORE.SEAR:
One intact document remains - an old yellowing newspaper clipping. It won't be of much use, but I add it to my database nonetheless.

New Database Entry discovered.
Unfortunately, the computer's hard drive is irreparably corrupted.
The computer was wiped clean before I got here. There is nothing to recover.
Some intact files are available on the computer, but nothing I haven't already discovered elsewhere. I find nothing else.
The computer has nothing of import.

Someone's left a solitaire game up. There's nothing else of interest on the computer.

Also, it looks as though they were about to lose.
The background on this computer depicts two kittens hugging in a field of daisies. There is nothing else of import to be found.
The user alphabetized the shortcuts on their desktop. There is nothing else of import to be found.
The background is a picture of a golden retriever in a science lab. It looks very confused. There is nothing else of import to be found.
This user never changed their default background. There is nothing else of import to be found. How dull.

After searching through the computer's database, I managed to piece together some files that piqued my interest.

New Database Entry unlocked.

Searching through the computer, I find some recoverable files that are still readable.

New Database Entry unlocked.

The computer looks pristine on the outside, but is corrupted internally. Still, I managed to find one uncorrupted file, and have added it to my database.

New Database Entry unlocked.

The computer was wiped almost completely clean, except for one file hidden in the recycle bin.

New Database Entry unlocked.

I search the computer, storing what useful data I can find in my own memory.

New Database Entry unlocked.

This computer is broken and requires some finessing to get working. Still, I recover a handful of interesting files.

New Database Entry unlocked.

The display is still functional. I copy its message into my database.

New Database Entry discovered.

All I find on the machine is a curt e-mail from a disgruntled employee.

New Database Entry discovered.
I look around but find nothing of interest.

I look around and recover an old file.

New Database Entry discovered.

There's a three-ringed binder inside. I scan the surviving documents.

New Database Entry discovered.

A discarded journal inside remains mostly intact. I scan the pages of use.

New Database Entry discovered.

A single page of a long printout remains legible. I scan it and add it to my database.

New Database Entry discovered.

A few loose papers can be found inside. I scan the ones that look interesting.

New Database Entry discovered.

I find a memory stick inside and copy its data into my database.

New Database Entry discovered.

I search my incoming message history and find a single entry. I move the odd message into my database.

New Database Entry discovered.

There's an old magazine article from a publication called the "Nucleoid" tucked in the top drawer. I add it to my database.

New Database Entry discovered.

I scour the internal systems and find something of interest.

New Database Entry discovered.

I see if I can salvage anything from the electronics. I add what I find to my database.

New Database Entry discovered.

I look for anything of interest within the abandoned machinery and add what I find to my database.

New Database Entry discovered.

STRINGS.UI.WELCOMEMESSAGEBODY:
I've awoken at the target location, but colonization efforts have already hit a hitch. I was supposed to land on the planet's surface, but became trapped many miles underground instead.

Although the conditions are not ideal, it's imperative that I establish a colony here and begin mounting efforts to escape.

STRINGS.WORLDS.BADLANDS.DESCRIPTION:
A barren location with an overabundance of mineral resources.

<smallcaps>The rocky terrain of The Badlands poses no immediate threats, but sparse resource availability will make expansion and technological progress challenging.</smallcaps>
STRINGS.WORLDS.BADLANDS.NAME: The Badlands
STRINGS.WORLDS.FOREST_DEFAULT.DESCRIPTIO:
A location with a natural abundance of trees.

<smallcaps>Colonizing Arboria will require careful planning right from the start. Because of its lack of metals, finding biological solutions to problems is a must.</smallcaps>
STRINGS.WORLDS.FOREST_DEFAULT.NAME: Arboria
STRINGS.WORLDS.FOREST_HOT.DESCRIPTION:
A location with oppressively hot temperatures.

<smallcaps>Temperatures on Aridio are much higher than expected. While resources are abundant, maintaining food and infrastructure could be difficult as our colony warms.</smallcaps>
STRINGS.WORLDS.FOREST_HOT.NAME: Aridio
STRINGS.WORLDS.FOREST_LUSH.DESCRIPTION:
A lush location rich in wildlife and life-sustaining resources.

<smallcaps>Establishing a foothold on Verdante will be challenging due to reduced food and oxygen options. However, abundant biological and mineral resources should afford excellent long-term growth.</smallcaps>
STRINGS.WORLDS.FOREST_LUSH.NAME: Verdante
STRINGS.WORLDS.HELICONA.DESCRIPTION: Due to its highly eliptical orbit around its host star, this rock is cold. Oh so very cold.
STRINGS.WORLDS.HELICONA.NAME: Helicona
STRINGS.WORLDS.OASIS.DESCRIPTION:
A desolate location with a cache of life-sustaining water trapped beneath the surface.

<smallcaps>A wide underground desert will pose temperature threats and strain the resources of a colony on Oasisse. However, surviving the challenge should present great industrial opportunities.</smallcaps>
STRINGS.WORLDS.OASIS.NAME: Oasisse
STRINGS.WORLDS.OCEANIA.DESCRIPTION:
A location with vast quantities of unpotable salt water.

<smallcaps>Oceania is quite stable and resource rich, but the majority of the area is covered in a saltwater ocean. Careful expansion and resource usage should lead to a successful colony.</smallcaps>
STRINGS.WORLDS.OCEANIA.NAME: Oceania
STRINGS.WORLDS.SANDSTONE_DEFAULT.DESCRIP:
A promising location with a balanced variety of resources.

<smallcaps>Terra meets all the requirements for Duplicant life and holds no surprises. It's an ideal location for a first attempt at establishing a colony.</smallcaps>
STRINGS.WORLDS.SANDSTONE_DEFAULT.NAME: Terra
STRINGS.WORLDS.SANDSTONE_FROZEN.DESCRIPT:
A frigid location marked by inhospitably low temperatures throughout.

<smallcaps>Rime's low temperatures will make finding water and establishing farms or ranches problematic. However, the wide spectrum of minerals and cool environment could lead to thriving industry.</smallcaps>
